Article Title: CBI seeks death for RGK convict,opposes similar plea by WB govt
Article Text:
Convicted in the RG Kar rape-murder case, Sanjay Roy.

KOLKATA: CBI filed Wednesday an appeal in Calcutta high court seeking death penalty for Sanjay Roy, convicted and sentenced Monday to life imprisonment for raping and murdering a 31-year-old resident doctor at RG Kar Medical College and Hospital on Aug 9 last year.The appeal, submitted before a division bench, also challenges the maintainability of a similar plea filed by Bengal govt Tuesday. The state had sought capital punishment for Roy after CM Mamata Banerjee expressed dissatisfaction with sessions court’s decision to spare Roy the gallows. The matter has been listed for hearing on Jan 27.CBI counsel Rajdeep Majumder argued that the state was not authorised to file appeals in cases investigated by central agencies, asserting that Union govt is the only competent authority to do so.Bengal advocate general Kishore Datta countered that the case was initially investigated by Kolkata police before being handed over to CBI, making the state’s appeal admissible.The trial court’s 172-page judgment indicates that CBI’s probe into the case is still ongoing. Judge Anirban Das said in his order: “In this case, a chargesheet was submitted only for the offence of rape and murder of the victim, and the actual offender was placed before this court for trial. It does not mean that the entire investigation process came to an end.”
Article Summary: CBI files appeal in Calcutta high court seeking death penalty for Sanjay Roy. Roy was convicted and sentenced Monday to life imprisonment for raping and murdering a 31-year-old resident doctor at RG Kar Medical College and Hospital. The appeal also challenges the maintainability of a similar plea filed by Bengal govt Tuesday.

Article Title: 14-month-old drowns in bucket in Tamil Nadu
Article Text:
Representative photo

A 14-month-old boy drowned in a bucket of water outside his home at Melachery in Tamil Nadu’s Chengalpet district earlier this week. The toddler was identified as M Augustine. He was the younger son of Manikandan, an electrician, and Joyce. The couple had wed in 2019 and also have a son aged four.On Monday afternoon, Manikandan was at work while Joyce was with the kids at home. She was sitting outside and feeding Augustine. Afterwards, she went inside the house. In the few seconds of her absence, Augustine fell into the bucket kept under a public tap near the house. Joyce returned to find Augustine in the bucket and took him out. She alerted neighbours and family members, who rushed the toddler to Chengalpet Govt Hospital, where he died Tuesday night. Palur Police registered a case.
Article Summary: 14-month-old boy drowned in a bucket of water outside his home at Melachery in Tamil Nadu’s Chengalpet district earlier this week. The toddler was identified as M Augustine. He was the younger son of Manikandan, an electrician, and Joyce.

Article Title: JDU sacks Manipur chief for revoking backing to Biren govt
Article Text:
Manipur CM Biren singh

PATNA: JDU sacked its Manipur unit president Kshetrimayum Biren Singh on Wednesday, hours after he wrote to the governor that his party had ‘withdrawn’ support to the BJP-led NDA govt in the northeastern state.“Our Manipur unit president Singh took the decision regarding withdrawal of support to the BJP-led govt without consulting the central leadership. He acted independently, inviting disciplinary action and his removal from the position,” JDU national spokesperson Rajeev Ranjan Prasad said. “We are with NDA, and the party’s Manipur unit will continue to support the BJP-led govt there.” JDU is an ally of BJP at the Centre and in Bihar, Jharkhand and Manipur.Earlier, Singh wrote to the Manipur governor on JDU’s letterhead, saying: “In the election to the state assembly of Manipur held in Feb-March 2022, six candidates set up by JDU were returned. After a few months, five MLAs of JDU defected to BJP. Trial under the 10th Schedule of the Constitution of India of the five MLAs is pending before the Speaker’s Tribunal. After JDU became a part of the INDIA bloc, support to the BJP-led govt was withdrawn by the party by informing the office of the governor, leader of the House (CM) and speaker,” the letter read.“As such, the seating arrangement of the lone MLA of JDU in Manipur, Mohd Abdul Nasir, was made in the opposition bench in the last session of the assembly by the speaker. It is, hereby, further reiterated that JDU’s Manipur unit does not support the BJP-led state govt, and our lone MLA, Abdul Nasir, shall be treated as an opposition MLA in the House,” Singh said in his letter.BJP has 37 legislators in the 60-member Manipur assembly, besides the support of five Naga People’s Front MLAs and three independents.
Article Summary: JDU sacked its Manipur unit president Kshetrimayum Biren Singh on Wednesday. Singh wrote to the governor that his party had ‘withdrawn’ support to the BJP- led NDA govt in the northeastern state. JDU is an ally of BJP at the Centre and in Bihar, Jharkhand and Manipur.

Article Title: Jalgaon Train Accident: At least 8 persons killed after being hit by train in Maharashtra's Jalgaon
Article Text:
Poll What Do You Think About the Train Accident? Accidents Show the Need for Better Safety Measures Tragic, Needs Thorough Investigation and Response

NEW DELHI: At least 12 people were killed in Maharashtra's Jalgaon district on Wednesday when they stepped onto the tracks after a rumour of fire onboard and were struck by another train approaching from the opposite direction.The incident occurred after the Pushpak Express came to an unscheduled halt around 5 pm when someone pulled the chain due to a rumour of fire on board. Unaware of the danger, they were struck by the Karnataka Express , leading to multiple casualties.The accident took place between Maheji and Pardhade stations near Pachora, more than 400 km from Mumbai, where the Lucknow-Mumbai Pushpak Express had halted after someone pulled the chain.The Maharashtra government declared a compensation of Rs 5 lakh for the families of those who lost their lives in the train accident in Jalgaon district. Chief minister Devendra Fadnavis, speaking from Davos through a video message, assured that the state would cover the medical expenses of the injured.Maharashtra chief minister Devendra Fadnavis condoled the deaths in the train accident. He said in a post, "The tragic incident of the loss of lives in a very unfortunate incident near Pachora in Jalgaon district is deeply distressing. I pay my heartfelt tributes to them. My colleague Minister Girish Mahajan and the Superintendent of Police have reached the spot, and the District Collector will reach there shortly.""Senior officials are reaching the spot, after which more information will be available," said Maharashtra minister Gulabrao Patil who is also the guardian minister of Jalgaon.Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath expressed grief over the train accident and has ordered adequate medical treatment for the injured.
Article Summary: At least 12 people killed when they stepped onto tracks after rumour of fire onboard. Unaware of the danger, they were struck by the Karnataka Express. Lucknow-Mumbai Pushpak Express had halted after someone pulled the chain. Maharashtra government declared a compensation of Rs 5 lakh for the families of those who lost their lives.

Article Title: Kapil Sharma Death Threat: Kapil Sharma, Rajpal Yadav, Remo D'Souza get death threats
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Comedian Kapil Sharma has reportedly received death threats targeting him, his family, relatives, and neighbors, police officials said on Thursday.Similar threats were also sent to actor Rajpal Yadav and choreographer Remo D'Souza Amboli has registered an FIR against an unknown person for sending threat mail to Bollywood choreographer Remo D'souza.A similar FIR has been registered on complaint filed by actor Rajpal Yadav.Police said both received the threat correspondence which was signed "BISHNU" (distinct from Bishnoi). Initial inquiries suggest the email originated from Pakistan.Meanwhile, actress Sugandha Mishra has registered a non-cognizable complaint at Oshiwara police station for similar threat.
Article Summary: Comedian Kapil Sharma has reportedly received death threats targeting him, his family, relatives, and neighbors. Similar threats were also sent to actor Rajpal Yadav and choreographer Remo D'Souza Amboli. Police said both received the threat correspondence which was signed "BISHNU"
